title: Mazda3 Skyactiv-X review: petrol refinement with diesel economy – too good to be true?
text:
If ever a special internal combustion engine has started in a more deserving place than in the Mazda3 then I’d like to know. When we favourably reviewed the current, fourth-generation family hatchback in diesel and petrol forms, we were promised more – much more – to come.

That day has arrived. So take note of the initials SPCCI (Mazda-speak for Spark Controlled Compression Ignition); is a study in combustion efficiency, particularly thermal efficiency. It aims to combine the efficiency advantages of a compression-ignition engine (diesel) with the cleaner burning and responsiveness of a spark-ignition (petrol) unit.

While its debut in the Mazda3 is the first application of this technology,...
